author: factcheck.afp.com
vclaim:
No, this is not a video of a food fight at a market in Singapore

A video has been viewed hundreds of thousands of times in multiple Facebook posts that claim it shows a food fight at a market in Singapore in April 2019. The claim is false; the video has circulated online since at least June 2018 in connection with an incident in China; the market in Singapore was closed for renovation at the time of the purported incident.

The video was shared in a Facebook post here on April 28, 2019, where it has been viewed more than 650,000 times and shared more than 10,000 times.

Below is a screenshot of the post:

The caption translates to English as: “Blk 409 Ang Mo Kio Lor10. This morning at 9 o’clock.”

“Blk 409 Ang Mo Kio” is a reference to the 409 AMK Market and Food Centre in the town of Ang Mo Kio in Singapore. Here is the market on Google Maps.

The video was also shared in other Facebook posts here and here with a similar claim.

But the claim is false; the video has circulated online since at least June 2018 in connection with an incident in China.

AFP conducted a reverse image search on Google using keyframes from the video. The search found this example of the full video on Chinese video streaming website Tencent published on June 4, 2018.

The Chinese language caption on the Tencent video translates to English as: "People are fighting in the vegetable market".

AFP also located this example of the video from the misleading Facebook posts published on YouTube on June 5, 2018.



The footage in the misleading Facebook posts has been edited from the original 2018 video.

Below are screenshot comparison of the video in the misleading Facebook posts (L), and the 2018 YouTube video (R).

The Chinese language description of the YouTube video translates to English as: “Pork hurled during fight between market sellers”.

The Chinese language captions added to the video translate to English as: “In recent days, chaos erupted at a wet market in Shanwei, Guangdong. Footage shows several sellers started a fight due to something trivial. A while later, several people started brawling, while a few women hurled pork at each other. The 'pork' fight caused a scene and attracted a group of spectators. Some netizens commented, ‘I can't even afford pork, and they are using it as a weapon’.”

The 409 AMK Market and Food Centre in Singapore is closed for renovation between April 1, 2019 and May 31, 2019, according to this announcement on the website for the Singapore’s National Environmental Agency.
